title: Krull–Akizuki theorem
summary: In algebra, the Krull–Akizuki theorem states the following: let A be a one-dimensional reduced noetherian ring,[1] K its total ring of fractions. If B is a subring of a finite extension L of K containing A then B is a one-dimensional noetherian ring. Furthermore, for every nonzero ideal I of B, B / I {\displaystyle B/I} is finite over A.[2]
